titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Chemical Marketing and Economics records 1976-1985
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Chemical Marketing and Economics records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Chemical Marketing and Economics was formed in September 1952 as one of the 33 divisions of ACS. The division is now called the Division of Business Development and Management.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the business records of the ACS Division of Chemical Marketing and Economics (1976-1985). Materials include financial statements, receipts, invoices, canceled checks, treasurer's reports, minutes of division board meetings, and miscellaneous correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
